sub_topic: Calculation of the number of electrons transferred in an electrochemical reaction
message_1:
What is the number of electrons transferred in the following electrochemical reaction: 

Cu(s) + 2Ag+(aq) -> Cu2+(aq) + 2Ag(s) 

(Note: the standard reduction potentials of Cu2+(aq)/Cu(s) and Ag+(aq)/Ag(s) are 0.34V and 0.80V, respectively)
message_2:
In this electrochemical reaction, Cu(s) is being oxidized to Cu2+(aq), and Ag+(aq) is being reduced to Ag(s).

The half-reactions for this process are:

Oxidation: Cu(s) -> Cu2+(aq) + 2e⁻
Reduction: 2Ag+(aq) + 2e⁻ -> 2Ag(s)

As we can see from the half-reactions, 2 electrons are being transferred in this electrochemical reaction.
